title: You may be perimenopausal.
desc: Stopping a medication that is regulating your periods would let us see what your natural cycle is like. However, based on your answers, you are likely in perimenopause, the phase leading up to menopause. This is when your body's level of estrogen fluctuates, which can cause menopausal symptoms and changes in your periods. Stopping a medication that is regulating your periods would let us see what your natural cycle is like. However, this is not necessarily required to treat menopausal symptoms or begin treatment for your symptoms.
symptoms: Mood changes like irritability or anxiety
